properties.LocationArea: SH 1 Dunedin, near the intersection with Anderson Bay Road.
properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing works, this road will be closed on Sunday to Thursday nights between 7:30pm and 6am from Sunday 12th October to Friday 17th October. Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for your travel. Please note these works are weather dependent and may be postponed at short notice.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Follow sign posted detours on site.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 1 Dunedin, near the intersection with Anderson Bay Road.

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 Silverstream, between Fergusson Drive and Whakatiki Street
properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing and intersection upgrade works, the section of road is closing in both directions on Sunday 12th October to Thursday 16th October nights between 9pm and 4:30am. Plan your journey, accordingly, allowing extra time for travel. Please note these works are dependent on various factors and may be postponed.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Detour via Whakatiki Street and Fergusson Drive.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 2 Silverstream, between Fergusson Drive and Whakatiki Street

properties.EventComments: Due to dam maintenance, there will be day time road closures from Monday 13 Oct to Friday 17 Oct between 8:00am and 7:00pm. Follow detours and expect delays.
properties.AlternativeRoute:
Northbound - turn right onto SH32, turn left onto Pohipi Rd, turn left onto Oruanui Rd, turn right onto Link Rd, return to SH1.

Reverse for Southbound.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 30 Whakamaru Dam

properties.EventComments: Due to road resurfacing, night time road closures will be in place on SH1 between the SH1/SH5 roundabout and SH1/28 intersection. Closures will occur Sunday 12 Oct -Thursday 16 Oct nights between 7pm-6am (finishing Friday morning). Follow detours and expect delays.
properties.AlternativeRoute:
Southbound: continue on to SH5, turn right onto SH28, return to SH1.
Reverse for Northbound.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 1 Tirau to Putaruru

properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing works Tuesday 14 to Thursday 16 from 7pm to 5am there will be Stop/Go operations in place with a 30kph temporary speed limit. After these hours will be uneven surface with 50kph temporary speed limit in place. Please drive with care.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 33 All Port Road

properties.EventComments: Due to various works on Remutaka Hill, the road is scheduled to close in both directions on Sunday 12th October to Thursday 16th October nights between 9pm and 4am. Plan your journey accordingly avoiding travel during these times. For access over the hill during these times, you will need a booking. Please visit www.nzta.govt.nz/remutaka prior to the closures to apply for a booking.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Northbound traffic use SH1 to Ohau, turn right onto SH57, follow along then turn right onto Pahiatua Aokautere Road and then back onto SH2. Reverse for southbound. Please note these detour routes will add approximately 3 and a half hours to your journey time.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 2 Kaitoke to Featherston (Remutaka Hill)

properties.LocationArea: SH 58 Haywards, between Hebden Crescent and Bradey Road intersection
properties.EventComments: Due to works for the SH58 Safety Improvements Project, there are temporary lane shifts and various speed restrictions in place. Plan your journey accordingly, allowing extra time to travel through this area.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 58 Haywards, between Hebden Crescent and Bradey Road intersection

properties.EventComments: Due to multiple slips in the area, SH31 is closed between Tihiroa and Kawhia.
properties.AlternativeRoute: No detour available. Avoid the area or delay your journey if possible.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 31 Tihiroa to Kawhia

properties.EventComments: Due to multiple slips blocking the road, SH3 between Mokau and Piopio is now closed. Road users are advised to avoid the area or delay their journey if possible. This closure is expected to remain in place until the morning of Thursday 16th.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 3 Mokau to Piopio

properties.LocationArea: SH 3 Whanganui, between the intersections of Heads Road and Alma Road, northbound
properties.EventComments: Due to concreting works, this section of road will be closed to southbound traffic from Monday 6th October to  Thursday 9th October and Wednesday 22nd October to Friday 24th October. Work will then move to a northbound closure from Friday 10th October to Tuesday 21st October. All work will be Mondays to Fridays between 6am and 6pm. Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel.
properties.AlternativeRoute:
Northbound traffic, detour via Heads Road, Mosston Road and Fitzherbert Avenue.
Southbound traffic will be detoured using Heads Road to Mosston Road to Fitzherbert Avenue then back to SH3.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 3 Whanganui, between the intersections of Heads Road and Alma Road, northbound

properties.LocationArea: SH 79 Middle Valley, near Bracefield Road
properties.EventComments: Following a prior crash, State Highway 79 is now open. Expect delays as congestion eases in the area
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 79 Middle Valley, near Bracefield Road

properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 1 Ward to Wharanui

properties.LocationArea: SH 4 Eight Mile Junction to Taumarunui
properties.EventComments: Due to multiple slips blocking the road, SH4 between Eight Mile Junction and Taumarunui is now closed. Road users are advised to avoid the area or delay their journey if possible.This closure is expected to remain in place until the morning of Thursday 16th.

properties.EventComments: Due to multiple slips blocking the road, SH43 between Taumarunui and Whangamomona is now closed. Road users are advised to avoid the area or delay their journey if possible. This closure is expected to remain in place until the morning of Thursday 16th.

properties.EventComments: Due to road resurfacing works taking place, SH1C Waikato Expressway, Te Rapa section, will be closed between the Horotiu interchange and Foreman Road, including the Wairere Drive southbound onramp. Works commence overnight from Sunday 12 October for 8 nights (Sunday to Thursday nights only), between 8pm and 5am each night. Northbound lanes are unaffected.
properties.AlternativeRoute: All southbound vehicles exit at the Horotiu interchange onto Te Rapa Road, Te Kowhai East Road, Arthur Porter Drive, Kiriwai Kaui Drive, Foreman Road to re-join SH1C
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 1C Horotiu to Avalon

properties.LocationArea: SH 1 Kaiapoi, between the intersection of Smith Street and William Street
properties.EventComments: Due to investigation work as part of the Woodend Bypass Project, the road will be closed to northbound traffic on Monday 13th October to Wednesday 15th October nights and to southbound traffic on Thursday 15th October to Friday 17th October and Monday 20th October nights between 9pm and 5am each night. Expect delays whilst these works are underway. This work depends on various factors and may be amended or rescheduled at short notice.
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 1 Kaiapoi, between the intersection of Smith Street and William Street

properties.EventComments: State Highway 29 Kaimai Ranges will be closed to all traffic from 7:30pm to 3:00am, from Sun 12 October to Friday 17 October (5 nights). Through-traffic between Waikato & BOP will need to take an alternative route. SH29 will be open each day from 3:00am until 7:30pm, under TTM and speed restrictions.
properties.AlternativeRoute:
North: SH2 to SH26 to SH1 to SH29 (and vice versa) - HPMV Compliant
South: all vehicles: SH2 to SH33 to SH30 to SH5 to SH28 to SH5, SH1 to SH27 to SH29 (and vice versa) - HPMV Compliant
properties.Name: Area Warning: SH 29 Kaimai Ranges

properties.LocationArea: SH 34 River Road to Kawerau Substation
properties.EventComments: Work Postponed Tuesday, 14 October **Wet Weather**. On Mon, 13 Oct (1 week), between 8:00 AM and 5:30 PM, Asphalt resurfacing will take place. Expect lane closures with stop/ go operations. Long holds will take place on Fletcher Avenue when plant and equipment are working on the intersection. Speed restrictions will remain until the line marking is reinstated. There will be an uneven road surface. Drive with care and expect moderate delays.
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 34 River Road to Kawerau Substation

properties.LocationArea: SH 34 Matata Road to State Highway 30
properties.EventComments: A road closure on State Highway 34 for Asphalt and chip seal resurfacing will start Monday, 20 October, between 7:00 AM to 5:00 PM, and Fri, 24 Oct till 12 PM. Lane closures with stop/ go traffic management will be in place on SH2 (Matata Road). A delay of 30 minutes can be expected while the plant and equipment are being moved through the intersection. Please drive carefully and follow crew instructions.
properties.AlternativeRoute: All vehicles SH30 (Military Road), continue to State Highway 2 (SH2) Awakeri Road, continue straight to (SH34) Awaiti South Road, and vice versa.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 34 Matata Road to State Highway 30

properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing work, traffic will be held in both directions for up to 20 minutes at a time on Sunday 19th October and Monday 20th October nights between 9pm and 4:30am. Work will then continue on the lanes north of the new roundabout. expect delays

properties.Name: News: South Island Regional and District Council Websites

properties.Content:
FINAL UPDATE THU 17 OCT 2019

Kuaotunu River bridge reopens

Our contractors have done a fantastic job to get the bridge opened ahead of schedule, and more than a week before Labour weekend, despite the heavy rain and strong winds that battered the area earlier this week. Traffic management remains in place, including a 30km/h speed restriction.

Please note that, weather dependent, the bridge will need to close again for the day on Monday (21 Oct) to carry out resurfacing works.

---------------

 

UPDATE TUE 08 OCT 2019

Repairing Kuaotunu bridge to reconnect SH25 

Work to repair the Kuaotunu Bridge on SH25 Coromandel after last month’s storm is progressing well, with the bridge expected to reopen within the next couple of weeks.

The repair team has finished driving the piles on the northern side of the bridge and has switched to the southern side. Once all the piles have been driven they will need to be cut to size and the bridge abutments filled with concrete before work to reinstate the bridge deck can begin.

“We understand that these works are frustrating for local residents and those who travel to the area often, however, our contractors are working as hard as they can to repair the damage as quickly and efficiently as possible,” says Transport Agency Waikato Systems Manager Karen Boyt.  

The Transport Agency has joined together with Thames Coromandel District Council to provide a free shuttle bus service from Kuaotunu to Whitianga every day while the bridge is closed.

The Go Kiwi shuttle departs from outside the Kuaotunu fire station, at 7:30am and 8:30am and then returns from Whitianga at 4:30pm and 5:30pm. From Wednesday 9 October there will also be a lunchtime bus leaving Whitianga at 11.30 and Kuaotunu at 12pm. 

Anyone travelling in the area should check our Journey Planner, www.journeys.nzta.govt.nz or call 0800 44 44 49 before leaving for the most up to date information. 

[image src="/assets/8e66b60fd1/NZTA-3.jpg" id="1023" width="657" height="507" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="NZTA 3"]

[image src="/assets/5b38db22be/nzta-2.jpg" id="1022" width="657" height="586" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="nzta 2"]

 

 ---------------

Following an assessment after recent heavy rain, the SH25 Kuaotunu River bridge has been closed, for around five weeks, to repair weather damage.

We understand the frustration this may cause for those who live in or travel to the area often, however our contractors are working as hard as they can to repair the damage as quickly and efficiently as possible.

During this time detours will be clearly signposted via either SH25A and SH25 or SH25 Thames Coast Road.

 [image src="/assets/dd1a4446a4/Kuaotunu-IMG_STOP.jpg" id="1019" width="251" height="303" class="ss-htmleditorfield-file image right" title="Kuaotunu IMG STOP"]
  • Residents south of Blackjack Road will need to access Kuaotunu from Whitianga.
  • Residents west of the bridge will only have vehicle access from the Coromandel side.
  • Pedestrians will be able to cross the river via a separate, existing walk bridge. 

We hope to have the bridge open again by Labour Weekend, however, this is weather dependant. We will keep the community updated, and thank you for your patience during this time.

 

UPDATE TUE 24 SEP 2019

Repair works to SH25 Kuaotonu River Bridge began on Sunday 22 Sep, following an early morning karakia by local Iwi. Our contractors have started to remove the wooden deck after stripping back the seal layers. The seal and deck have been removed by hand, and efforts made to protect the environment by installing a platform below the deck.
